unit_learning_outcomes.description: Conduct short Chinese English dialogue interpreting in community
Reflect on interpreting practice with reference to relevant interpreting theories
Identify and discuss the fundamental interpreting theories

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on shadowing/interpreting practice, reflection of their practice and going through relevant materials provided in iLearn to prepare for all learning activities.

enrolment_rules.description: CHIN2052 or CHN252 or CHIN2053 or CHN253

assessments.description: Students are to take notes for and reflect on their interpreting practice. A reflective journal needs to be submitted.
Students are to deliver a speech and interpret a speech delivered by a student peer.
Students are to practice and prepare to complete practice based tasks.
Students are to deliver a story using interpreting skills and do dialogue interpreting.
Students are to read and watch provided materials in iLearn and participate in discussions, as well as provide comments on peer students’ practice.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is an introductory unit for interpreting between Mandarin Chinese and English. Students who enjoy both Chinese and English language proficiency will understand that to be a trained interpreter needs more than the fluency in both languages. They will learn how professional interpreters work in different scenarios, such as community interpreting practice. They will also pick up the key interpreting theories and skills and be able to conduct short Chinese-English dialogue interpreting and develop general inter-lingual communication skills that contributes to their future learning and work.
data.title: Chinese-English-Chinese Interpreting I

title: Chinese-English-Chinese Interpreting I
